p: Many key virulence genes of Salmonella enterica are present on Salmonella pathogenicity islands (SPIs) [ 30]. In general, SPI-1 to 6 were highly conserved, consistent with their key role in pathogenesis. However, SPI-4 containing the sii locus that encodes a giant adhesin secreted by a type I secretions system [ 31], exhibited elevated sequence divergence in several β subclades ( S3 Fig). SPI-6 that encodes a type VI secretion system that mediates a cell contact dependent mechanisms of interbacterial antagonism involved in colonisation of the intestine [ 32], exhibited moderate sequence variation in isolates in subclade β7.
